In August 2020, Vértice Cine announced their involvement as a production studio on the movie, The Expendables 4.

In August 2020, Vértice Cine announced their involvement as a production studio on the movie, The Expendables 4. They also revealed that Patrick Hughes will return to the series as director.

In November 2020, the president of Millennium Media, Jeffrey Greenstein, stated that the studio is continuing to work on The Expendables 4 after various delays within the industry worldwide due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
In August 2021, The Hollywood Reporter reported that Scott Waugh would be directing the film, replacing Hughes.

Sylvester Stallone further stated that production was set to commence in October of that year. The Expendables 4 was the same project as The Expendables: A Christmas Story, previously reported as a spin-off but in fact the film's working-title during development.

As of November 5, 2023, Expend4bles has grossed $51 million worldwide. In the United States and Canada, the film initially projected to gross $15-17 million in its opening weekend and went on debut to $8 million finishing second behind holdover The Nun II. It fell 69% to $2.5 million in its second weekend, finishing in ninth place.
In China, the film opened to $10.7 million, narrowly finishing first before a Chinese film.

node_2: original selling point of featuring an all-star cast of action legends
edge: The movie hardly retains the franchise's original selling point of featuring an all-star cast of action legends in comparison to its predecessors, criticized by multiple reviews.

Refashioning The Expendables into a Statham star vehicle only highlights the wrong kind of expendability from many of his long-time costars; why can't we just watch our man kick ass on his own or in various duos?

Thompson called the "clunky and uninspired dialogue" awful, concluding that the film was overall a "crushing disappointment that lacks any of the nostalgia, charisma, and charm that made the franchise appealing"
Feeling that especially the final battle was an exact copy of Meg 2, another 2023 action film starring Statham.
